intro: Boivinella glomerulifera, commonly known as the clustered leaf cactus, is a succulent plant native to South America. It is characterized by its compact, rounded shape and dense clusters of fleshy, spiny stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the warmer months, which are followed by red, berry-like fruits. Its leaves are typically reduced to spines, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Boivinella glomerulifera is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
